dcterms:description: TORCS is an open-source 3D racing car simulator that accurately simulates vehicle dynamics, including mass, rotational inertia, impacts, suspension dynamics, linkages, differentials, friction, and aerodynamics. It is widely used in the research community for simulation.
dcterms:title: TORCS (The Open Racing Car Simulator)

dcterms:creator: A. Fogla
K. Kumar
S. Saurav
dcterms:description: The Forza track data is generated using the TORCS simulator, where a tuned PID controller drives the car on the Forza road track to collect LIDAR distance measurements and corresponding steering values.
dcterms:title: Forza track data (generated using TORCS)

dcterms:description: E-Track 4 is used for testing the BNN controller, characterized by its twists and turns and complexity in the track profile.
dcterms:title: E-Track 4 (used for testing the BNN controller)
